demos.prompt:
[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'title': 'ServiceOutageIncident', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'incidentID': {'title': 'Incident ID', 'type': 'string'}, 'startTime': {'format': 'date-time', 'title': 'Start Time', 'type': 'string'}, 'endTime': {'format': 'date-time', 'title': 'End Time', 'type': 'string'}, 'servicesAffected': {'items': {'type': 'string'}, 'title': 'Services Affected', 'type': 'array'}, 'resolutionStatus': {'title': 'Resolution Status', 'type': 'string'}}, 'required': ['incidentID', 'startTime', 'servicesAffected', 'resolutionStatus']}
</schema>
", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': "Hello, I am a network operations analyst at ComNet Telecom. We've experienced a service outage that needs to be documented for our records and customer notifications. The outage incident ID is 'OUT20230418-001'. It started on April 18th, 2023, at 3:30 PM UTC and ended on April 18th, 2023, at 6:45 PM UTC. The services affected were 'Mobile Data', 'Voice Calls', and 'SMS Messaging'. The resolution status is currently 'Resolved'. Could you please provide me with a JSON object that accurately represents this service outage incident for our tracking system?", 'role': 'user'}]

[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'title': 'LoanApplication', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'applicationID': {'title': 'Application ID', 'type': 'string'}, 'applicantDetails': {'type': 'object', 'properties': {'name': {'title': 'Name', 'type': 'string'}, 'income': {'title': 'Income', 'type': 'number'}, 'creditScore': {'title': 'Credit Score', 'type': 'integer'}}, 'required': ['name', 'income', 'creditScore']}, 'loanType': {'title': 'Loan Type', 'type': 'string'}, 'amountRequested': {'title': 'Amount Requested', 'type': 'number'}, 'repaymentSchedule': {'title': 'Repayment Schedule', 'type': 'string'}}, 'required': ['applicationID', 'applicantDetails', 'loanType', 'amountRequested', 'repaymentSchedule']}
</schema>
", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': "I am submitting a loan application to Central City Bank and need to create a structured JSON object with my application details. My application ID is 'CCB-981276', my name is 'Barry Allen', my annual income is $85,000, and my credit score is 750. I am applying for a 'Home Improvement Loan' for the amount of $20,000. The repayment schedule agreed upon is 'Monthly payments for 5 years'. Please respond with a valid JSON object that includes these details.", 'role': 'user'}]

[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'type': 'object', 'properties': {'BudgetManagement': {'type': 'object', 'properties': {'monthly_income': {'type': 'number'}, 'expenses': {'type': 'array', 'items': {'type': 'object', 'properties': {'category': {'type': 'string'}, 'amount': {'type': 'number'}}, 'required': ['category', 'amount']}}, 'savings_goal': {'type': 'number'}}, 'required': ['monthly_income', 'expenses', 'savings_goal']}}}
</schema>
", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': 'I need to create a monthly budget plan. My monthly income is $4500. Here are my expenses: Rent is $1200, groceries are $600, utilities are $300, transportation is $250, and insurance is $150. I also want to set aside $500 for savings. Could you assist me by generating a JSON object that represents my monthly budget plan?', 'role': 'user'}]

[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'title': 'CustomerFeedback', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'feedbackID': {'title': 'Feedback ID', 'type': 'string'}, 'customerID': {'title': 'Customer ID', 'type': 'string'}, 'productID': {'title': 'Product ID', 'type': 'string'}, 'rating': {'title': 'Rating', 'type': 'integer', 'minimum': 1, 'maximum': 5}, 'comments': {'title': 'Comments', 'type': 'string'}}, 'required': ['feedbackID', 'customerID', 'productID', 'rating']}
</schema>
", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': "I recently purchased a set of solar panels from SunPower Corp for my home. The model number is SPWR-220, and I'd like to submit my feedback regarding the product. My customer ID is 76234987, and I have the feedback form in front of me. The feedback ID on the form is FDBK-987654. I would rate the product a 4 out of 5 as it meets most of my expectations but took longer than expected to install. My comments on the product are: 'The solar panels are highly efficient and have significantly reduced my electricity bills. However, the installation process was cumbersome and took two days longer than the scheduled time. The installation team was professional, but I believe the process could be more streamlined.' Please respond with a valid JSON object that captures my feedback.", 'role': 'user'}]
demos.step_by_step_instructions:
```json
{
  "feedbackID": "FDBK-987654",
  "customerID": "76234987",
  "productID": "SPWR-220",
  "rating": 4,
  "comments": "The solar panels are highly efficient and have significantly reduced my electricity bills. However, the installation process was cumbersome and took two days longer than the scheduled time. The installation team was professional, but I believe the process could be more streamlined."
}
```
demos.constructed_json_object:
{
  "feedbackID": "FDBK-987654",
  "customerID": "76234987",
  "productID": "SPWR-220",
  "rating": 4,
  "comments": "The solar panels are highly efficient and have significantly reduced my electricity bills. However, the installation process was cumbersome and took two days longer than the scheduled time. The installation team was professional, but I believe the process could be more streamlined."
}

predictor.signature_instructions: Proposed Instruction: Transform the provided text with key-value pairs into a valid JSON object that conforms to the specified JSON schema. Ensure all required fields are included and that data types match the expected format in the schema. Use curly braces to encapsulate your resulting JSON structure, commas to separate items within an array, colons to separate keys from values, and quotation marks for string literals.

retry_predictor.signature_instructions:
This signature is designed to handle errors in JSON object construction by focusing on identifying and rectifying the errors in the JSON output. The model uses this signature to understand the nature of the error and to guide the correction process in a retry mechanism. This is crucial for tasks requiring high accuracy in data format and structure adherence to a JSON schema.

    Instructions: Review the incorrect JSON object, identify the mismatches against the specified JSON schema, and modify the text or processing logic to correct these errors. The goal is to refine the JSON output in subsequent iterations until it fully complies with the JSON schema.
